title: How to Make Bibimbap

steps.headline: Create the gochujang sauce.
steps.description: Combine the Korean red pepper paste, sesame oil, soy sauce, minced garlic cloves, minced ginger and sesame seeds together in a small bowl. This completes the sauce, it can now be set aside.

steps.headline: Heat up some cooking oil in a heavy-bottomed pan on medium heat.
steps.description: Season and sauté the vegetables one at a time. Once all the vegetables are cooked properly, set aside.

steps.headline: Set up 4 bowls.
steps.description: Place 1 cup of rice in each of the bowls. Arrange the vegetables on top, along with 2 slices of bulgogi for each rice bowl. Make sure it looks appealing. Place a fried egg on top of the rice (the egg can also be raw if you like). Add bulgogi with the rice (bulgogi literally means fire meat).

steps.headline: Pour the gochujang sauce on top.
steps.description: Don't add too much because this sauce is pretty spicy!

steps.headline: Enjoy your bibimbap.
steps.description: Before eating, mix up the rice it should turn red when mixed well.
